metadata.title: CVE-2010-4150 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in the imap_do_open function in the IMAPextension (ext/imap/php_imap.c) in PHP 5.2 before 5.2.15 and 5.3 before5.3.4 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) orpossibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-4150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php5-imap - 5.3.5-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
php-imap package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.5-0ubuntu1').
